He said in an interview with the Financial Times that Russia seeks to freeze the fighting in Ukraine, at least for a short period of time, so that they can regroup, repair, recover and then try to launch a bigger offensive next spring. Stoltenberg's statement supports the Institute for the Study of Wars Assessment that an operational pause would favour Russia by depriving Ukraine of the initiative. Now, Russian forces are likely increasing the pace of their counter-attacks in eastern Kharkiv and also in western Luhansk regions.
